Kup:

Kup followed Tucson and after he stopped to pay his tribute to Oprtim=
us Prime, he said in low voice "I guess that you wants to know the details =
of the capture of Nightlight and Rodimus, right?"


From: Sandy 
Sent: Satu=
rday, March 13, 2010 12:16 AM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Back=
 to the Ark


  
With his determination, Tucson reaches the ark in vehicle =
form as he transmits an access code to get into the Ark without harming him=
self or Lord Elder. He comes to a screeching halt inside, gently opening hi=
s front door, and lowering his left side to gently set Lord Elder out of hi=
s cab on his feet, and then rolls back to transform into robot mode.

"Sorr=
y to push you out like that in such a hurry Lord Elder, I promise I will gi=
ve you fair warning the next time I do that."

He then finds his old friend=
 Kup. He never thought he'd see his old friend again, after being stuck in =
the torture chamber in the dark fortress. But after being beaten severely, =
dented and damaged, he now found himself home among his comrades. Even if i=
t was just Kup and Elita, he felt like he was finally home.

" It's good to=
 be back Kup, I missed you both immensely. Now, before I forget, you asked =
me of news of Rodimus and Nightlight. Unfortunately, the Predacons have pla=
ced a shell program over Rodimus which has corrupted his physical and menta=
l state. I fear the same fate awaits Nightlight. But I promise both of you,=
 I will NOT give up on them. But, in order for me to rescue them, we'll nee=
d more help and we also have to deal with the threat outside. That won't be=
 easy. We have many issues happening all around us and very few of us to de=
al with them. But I feel that we can't do everything unless we recover Rodi=
mus and Nightlight, and bring them back home where they belong."

He sighs.=


" From what I remember, there are also Decepticons lying on the floor amo=
ng our comrades. Decepticons who have been cast asside like junk all for po=
wer and greed. If we're going to revive the Autobots we - will also revive =
the Decepticons. I know it's hard to do, seeing their track record but, som=
etimes your greatest enemy can turn out to be your friend. We'll need all t=
he help we can get. Kup, thank you for getting my weapon ready. I appreciat=
e it deeply. But now, I - need to pay a visit to Optimus Prime."

Tucson fe=
els his way around in the Ark, remembering where things were before his los=
s of sight, and even afterwards. He comes to where Optimus Prime lays dorme=
nt and where many Autobots and Decepticons lie in a state of stasis as well=
. He feels where he believes is where Optimus Prime is not too far from him=
, and kneels down before his past leader. 

" You always knew how to handle=
 tough situations. No matter the level of difficulty you always led the Aut=
obots into victory. I miss your guidence, and wisdom and wish you were here=
 now to lend me a hand, because Primus knows I could use it. Rodimus has be=
en taken wrongfully from us, by Hydras and Cyclonus. I don't know exactly h=
ow it happened, and why it happened. Why would a warrior as strong as Rodim=
us ever give into such an evil force? After he became our leader, I thought=
 the world of him as I did of you. I will never lose sight of his wisdom bu=
t why do I feel as if I've been betrayed? Optimus, I've also been asked how=
 I'm related to you. I can't answer that question because I didn't know the=
 answer. And I still don't know the answer."

He raises his head as if to l=
isten for any signs of life.

" I do promise you something Optimus Prime, e=
ven through thoughts of betrayal, I will never turn a blind eye on my Autob=
ot comrade, even though, anger almost made me think otherwise. I have to cu=
rb my temper, I'm aware of that. Unless I know the story from Rodimus's poi=
nt of view I will not judge him as you have taught me. Innocent until prove=
n guilty. Well, that's about it Optimus, I haven't much more to tell you or=
 to ask of you. May you rest peacefully in the arms of Primus himself." 

H=
e gets back up onto his feet, and salutes Optimus Prime.

oogroups.com, <airly2002@...> wrote:

> Kup:
> 
> 
> "Count with that!! " =
Said Kup whose ran towards Tucson's quarters and Set a good amount of Arrow=
s in Tucson's crossbow, then he opened his con link and said "your weapon i=
s ready... Lord Elder what's the safest place of the Ark? if A battle start=
s here i want to place Elita in the safest point."
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> From: S=
andy 
> Sent: Friday, March 12, 2010 10:02 PM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com =

> Subject: Re: Back to the Ark
> 
> 
> 
> Tucson knew how to deal with fol=
lowers. If they were still in the area, a good sonic blast from his sonar s=
ystem would surely mess up their telemetry and do a number on their own gyr=
oscopic systems. He comes to a short halt, tired of being stalked, he kicks=
 up dust around short pivoting tires with a loud screech, and configures hi=
s sonar attack to be harmless to Autobt and Maximal kind but NOT harmless t=
o Predacons or Decepticons! 
> 
> " That's it, I am not going to play by th=
e rules ANY MORE! THEY WANT TROUBLE THEY GOT IT!"
> 
> He blasts the sonar =
attack at full pitch.
> 
> " Kup, if you pick up a sonar disturbance, don't=
 worry, it's me. It may effect your computer systems and I do appologize fo=
r that. But whatever or whoever is out there isn't about to get away that e=
asy!" 
> 
> He puts himself into drive and continues his drive toward the A=
rk, blasting the attack continuously.
> 
> "They think I'm a pushover on wh=
eels, they'll think twice after this, I assure you Lord Elder... They'll th=
ink twice."
> 
> He tries really hard to hold back a short temper. Tucson k=
new when to play games and when it was time to get serious. This was the ti=
me to get serious.
> 
> "Oh yeah, Kup, in my quarters you'll find a cross b=
ow in my weapon chamber. Please, have that ready for me when I get back and=
 make sure to put a good amount of plasma arrows in the energizer for me. Y=
ou'll find all of that near an old sun dial I was working on before I left =
the Ark ages ago."
> 
> He turns his attentions back to Lord Elder.
> 
> " =
Before all this happened to me, my spare time was spent restorring old arti=
facts and weapons. I'm hoping to go back to doing some resteration, it's th=
e only thing that quells my temper which I do admit, gets rather short in t=
imes like these. Remind me to show you what I've done when we get back to t=
he Ark. I have a small work area in my quarters where I've managed to resto=
re a few small artifacts... Well including one fairly large sun dial.. But =
most of all, I've saved and restorred ancient Autobot weaponry which may st=
ill prove useful to us now. I have a feeling we might just need it."
> 
> -=

 > The trip back is mildly uneventful. The day moved forward as the sun

o a sauropod, who's small head on a long neck turned to look

icle passed by, and even the smaller variety of creatures,

ers to predator, ones who typically scattered as the
> > vehicle that was T=
uscon bounced and yet moved easily across the broken
> > terrain.

Up ahead the trees, which had been near constant companions during
> > most=
 of their trip began to break away as they came into more open
> > country.=
 Up ahead the beginnings of a mountain range could be seen.
> > Above them =
a flock of what could almost look like birds flew, although
> > instead of =
possessing feathers, they had large leathery and larger
> > bodies.
> > 
> =
> "We're almost back" Lord Elder said. He had been silent through most
> > =
of the trip, his face wearing a thoughtful look. "There, that mountain
> > =
over there, at the base of it."
> > 
> > "I'll activate the door in the shi=
eld for us." Elder said as he was
> > about to open a communication signal =
to the Ark. However Elder paused
> > and look around, as if looking for som=
ething. "Something's wrong here
> > . . . " he said as he continued to look=
.
> > 
> > Above them the prehistoric avians turned almost as one, their ca=
lls
> > almost defiant as they moved swiftly in the direction that Tuscon a=
nd
> > Elder had come from. "It's like we're being watched."
> >

<P>With his determination,=
 Tucson reaches the ark in vehicle form as he 
transmits an access code to =
get into the Ark without harming himself or Lord 
Elder. He comes to a scre=
eching halt inside, gently opening his front door, and 
lowering his left s=
ide to gently set Lord Elder out of his cab on his feet, and 
then rolls ba=
ck to transform into robot mode.<BR><BR>"Sorry to push you out like 
that i=
n such a hurry Lord Elder, I promise I will give you fair warning the next =

time I do that."<BR><BR>He then finds his old friend Kup. He never thought=
 he'd 
see his old friend again, after being stuck in the torture chamber i=
n the dark 
fortress. But after being beaten severely, dented and damaged, =
he now found 
himself home among his comrades. Even if it was just Kup and =
Elita, he felt like 
he was finally home.<BR><BR>" It's good to be back Kup=
, I missed you both 
immensely. Now, before I forget, you asked me of news =
of Rodimus and Nightlight. 
Unfortunately, the Predacons have placed a shel=
l program over Rodimus which has 
corrupted his physical and mental state. =
I fear the same fate awaits Nightlight. 
But I promise both of you, I will =
NOT give up on them. But, in order for me to 
rescue them, we'll need more =
help and we also have to deal with the threat 
outside. That won't be easy.=
 We have many issues happening all around us and 
very few of us to deal wi=
th them. But I feel that we can't do everything unless 
we recover Rodimus =
and Nightlight, and bring them back home where they 
belong."<BR><BR>He sig=
hs.<BR><BR>" From what I remember, there are also 
Decepticons lying on the=

cast asside like junk=

Autobots we - will =

their track re=

friend. We=

rea=
dy. I appreciate it deeply. But now, I - need to pay a visit to Optimus 
Pr=

gs

Autobots into victory. I miss your guidence,=

now to lend me a hand, because Primus k=

happened, and why it happened. W=

give into such an evil force?=

if I've been bet=

can't answe=
r that question because I didn't know the answer. And I still don't

ough, 
anger almost made me think otherwise. I have to curb my temper, I'm =
aware of 
that. Unless I know the story from Rodimus's point of view I will=

as you have taught me. Innocent until proven guilty. Well, =

Optimus, I haven't much more to tell you or to ask of you.=

peacefully in the arms of Primus himself." <BR><BR>He gets b=
